009package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
010
011import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
012
013import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.max;
014import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.min;
015
016
017/**
018 * <p>
019 * Implementation of HLS (hue/lightness/saturation) color space. See Sec. 13.2.3 of [1] for additional details. All
020 * component values are assumed to be in [0,1]. Note that sRGB components passed to method {@link #fromRGB(float[])}
021 * and returned by method {@link #toRGB(float[])} are NOT converted to linear RGB.
022 * This is a singleton class with no public constructors, use {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the single instance.
023 * </p>
024 * <p>
025 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
026 * (2022).
027 * </p>
028 *
029 * @author WB
030 * @version 2022/09/04
031 */
032@SuppressWarnings("serial")
033public class HlsColorSpace extends ColorSpace {
034        
035        private static final HlsColorSpace instance = new HlsColorSpace();
036        
037        public static HlsColorSpace getInstance() {
038                return instance;
039        }
040        
041        private HlsColorSpace() {
042                super(ColorSpace.TYPE_HLS, 3);
043        }
044
045        @Override
046        public float[] fromRGB(float[] rgb) {
047                final float r = rgb[0], g = rgb[1], b = rgb[2]; // r, g, b assumed to be in [0,1]
048                final float cHi = max(r, g, b);         // max. component value
049                final float cLo = min(r, g, b);         // min. component value
050                final float cRng = cHi - cLo;                   // component range
051                
052                // Calculate lightness L
053                float L = (cHi + cLo) / 2;
054                
055                // Calculate saturation S               
056                float S = 0;
057                if (0 < L && L < 1) {
058                        float d = (L <= 0.5f) ? L : (1 - L);
059                        S = 0.5f * cRng / d;
060                }
061                
062                // Calculate hue H (same as in HSV)
063                float H = 0;    
064                if (cHi > 0 && cRng > 0) {        // a color pixel
065                        float dr = (cHi - r) / cRng;
066                        float dg = (cHi - g) / cRng;
067                        float db = (cHi - b) / cRng;
068                        float h;
069                        if (r == cHi)                      // R is largest component
070                                h = db - dg;
071                        else if (g == cHi)                 // G is largest component
072                                h = dr - db + 2.0f;
073                        else                               // B is largest component
074                                h = dg - dr + 4.0f;
075                        if (h < 0)
076                          h = h + 6;
077                        H = h / 6;
078                }
079                return new float[] {H, L, S};
080        }
081        
082        @Override
083        public float[] toRGB(float[] hls) {
084                final float H = hls[0], L = hls[1], S = hls[2]; // H,L,S in [0,1]
085                float r = 0, g = 0, b = 0;      
086                if (L <= 0)                             // black
087                        r = g = b = 0;
088                else if (L >= 1)                // white
089                        r = g = b = 1;
090                else {
091                        float hh = (6 * H) % 6;
092                        int   c1 = (int) hh;
093                        float c2 = hh - c1;
094                        float d = (L <= 0.5f) ? (S * L) : (S * (1 - L));
095                        float w = L + d;
096                        float x = L - d;
097                        float y = w - (w - x) * c2;
098                        float z = x + (w - x) * c2;
099                        switch (c1) {
100                                case 0: r = w; g = z; b = x; break;
101                                case 1: r = y; g = w; b = x; break;
102                                case 2: r = x; g = w; b = z; break;
103                                case 3: r = x; g = y; b = w; break;
104                                case 4: r = z; g = x; b = w; break;
105                                case 5: r = w; g = x; b = y; break;
106                                default: // this should not happen
107                        }                       
108                }       // r, g, b in [0,1]
109                return new float[] {r, g, b};
110        }
111
112        @Override
113        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] colorvalue) {
114                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
115        }
116
117        @Override
118        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] colorvalue) {
119                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
120        }
121        
122        private static final String[] ComponentNames = {"H", "L", "S"};
123        
124        @Override
125        public String getName (int idx) {
126                return ComponentNames[idx];
127        }
128
129}
